summary: Stephen Fleming is a former cricketer from New Zealand who also captained the team.

value.label: Stephen Paul Fleming
Invalid Date (age 46)
Christchurch, New Zealand
New Zealander
Batsman
Fleming was an elegant left handed batsman, off-break bowler, and prolific fielder in the slips

image.altText: Style of play for Stephen Fleming

value.label: Fleming first played for the Canterbury, first class team during the 1991-92 season.
Fleming made his Test debut in March 1994 against India, winning the Man of the Match award in the match.

The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.

image.altText: Image of India national cricket team

value.label: Fleming played for the Chennai Super Kings in the 2008 and scored 196 runs in 10 matches.
Founded in 2008, The Chennai Super Kings (CSK) is an Indian franchise cricket team based in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, which plays in the Indian Premier League (IPL).

value.label: 2000 - Fleming became New Zealand's most successful captain with 12 test match wins

image.altText: 2000 - Fleming became New Zealand's most successful captain with 12 test match wins

value.label: Fleming holds the record of most ODI matches played by a New Zealander

image.altText: Fleming holds the record of most ODI matches played by a New Zealander

value.label: 2006 - Fleming captained his country for the 194th time in an ODI, breaking the earlier world record set by Arjuna Ranatunga.

image.altText: 2006 - Fleming captained his country for the 194th time in an ODI, breaking the earlier world record set by Arjuna Ranatunga.

value.label: Fleming is the most capped Test and ODI Captain for New Zealand.

image.altText: Fleming is the most capped Test and ODI Captain for New Zealand.

value.label: The New Zealand national cricket team, nicknamed the Black Caps, played their first Test in 1930 against England in Christchurch, becoming the fifth country to play Test cricket.

value.label: Canterbury is a New Zealand First-class cricket team based in Canterbury, New Zealand.
New Zealand Order of Merit is an honour established by royal warrant by Queen Elizabeth II, to honour persons who have rendered meritorious service in any field of endeavour.
